meanings.definition: Twist or bend out of the normal shape
meanings.sent1: She contorts her body to fit into the small box.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast contorts her limbs into impressive shapes.
meanings.sent3: The contorting clown made everyone laugh at the circus.
meanings.sent4: His face contorts in pain as he tries to lift the heavy weight.
meanings.sent5: The contorted tree branches reached out like twisted fingers.

meanings.definition: Distort or twist out of the natural or normal shape or condition
meanings.sent1: The magician contorts reality with his mind-bending tricks.
meanings.sent2: The artist contorts the metal into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The contorting mirror made her reflection look funny.
meanings.sent4: His words contort the truth, making it hard to understand.
meanings.sent5: The contorted path through the forest led to a hidden waterfall.
